The laws of physics in my universe would be different from those in our universe. For example, gravity could be weaker or stronger, and the speed of light could be different.
My universe could have different dimensions, such as four or five dimensions, and the laws of physics could be different in those dimensions.
The laws of my universe could be governed by a different force, such as a new particle or force that has not been discovered in our universe.
My universe could have different rules for the formation and evolution of galaxies, stars, and planets.
The laws of my universe could be different in terms of the properties of matter and energy, such as allowing for the existence of dark matter and dark energy.
